bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 104 (Thursday, June 20, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CUNNINGHAM:H.R. 3387.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 14: ``To make Rules for theGovernment and Regulation of the land and naval Forces;''Article I, Section 8, Clause 18: ``To make all Laws whichshall be necessary and proper for carrying into Execution theforegoing powers . . .''[Page H5007]

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2020

latestAction.text: Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 512.

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text: This bill authorizes the U.S. Coast Guard to carry out a pilot program to establish and maintain a Junior Reserve Officers' Training Corps program unit in cooperation with Lucy Garrett Beckham High School in Charleston County, South Carolina.

bill.title: To create a pilot program for the Junior Reserve Officers' Training Corps program at Lucy Garrett Beckham High School, and for other purposes.

item.title: To create a pilot program for the Junior Reserve Officers' Training Corps program at Lucy Garrett Beckham High School, and for other purposes.
To create a pilot program for the Junior Reserve Officers' Training Corps program at Lucy Garrett Beckham High School, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
